summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to various recipients, primarily alleging massive, ongoing securities fraud involving Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial (NITE/VIRT). He accuses the SEC, Jefferies, and others of criminal obstruction, covering up illegal naked short selling and money laundering through OTC markets, and facilitating fraudulent mergers. The emails reference multiple other cases and individuals, including Dan Kamensky, and demand investigations and disclosures.

persons.context: Author of the emails, making extensive allegations of securities fraud, money laundering, and SEC corruption related to Knight Capital, KCG, and Virtu Financial.

events.title: Knight Capital 'Glitch'
events.description: A trading glitch at Knight Capital that resulted in massive losses, which Dilorio claims was a cover-up for the firm's insolvency due to illegal naked shorting.

events.title: VIRT/KCG Merger Closing
events.description: The closing of the $1.4 billion merger between Virtu Financial and KCG Holdings, which Dilorio alleges was fraudulent, based on inflated tangible book value and written-down naked short fails.

events.title: Dilorio's Initial TCR Filing
events.description: Christopher Dilorio filed his first Tip, Complaint, or Referral (TCR) with the SEC, detailing allegations against Knight Capital, which he claims led to subsequent SEC/FINRA actions.

events.title: VIRT Q3 2020 Earnings Call
events.description: Virtu Financial's Q3 2020 earnings call, which Dilorio references to highlight the lack of tough questions from analysts about balance sheet fraud and OTC trading.

events.title: Formal Appeal for Award Denial
events.description: Dilorio sends a formal appeal summary for the preliminary denial of his whistleblower award related to covered action 2015-016 (Knight Capital).

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThruEquity
events.description: The SEC brings a complaint against SeeThruEquity, LLC, Ajay Tandon, and Amit Tandon for pump-and-dump schemes, which Dilorio claims involved Net Element (NETE) and was based on his information.

events.title: SEC 'Shell Factory' Complaint
events.description: The SEC files a complaint against Jaclin et al., detailing a 'shell factory' operation, which included New Image Concepts (later Blink Charging), a shell later involved with Justin Keener.

keyFacts: Christopher Dilorio, an SEC whistleblower, alleges a massive, ongoing fraud where Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial (NITE/VIRT) engages in abusive naked short selling of OTC market shells to facilitate money laundering, with the SEC and Jefferies colluding to cover it up.

Dilorio claims the 2012 Knight 'glitch' and the 2017 VIRT/KCG merger were cover-ups for insolvency caused by illegal naked shorting, and that the SEC, Handler (Jefferies), and Cifu (Virtu) wrote down billions in fraud assets to inflate the merger price.

The emails allege widespread corruption, including SEC Chairman Jay Clayton's undisclosed conflicts due to his Sullivan & Cromwell ties and friendship with Glenn Hutchins, and the protection of entities like AQR, Blackstone, and various 'bag men' like Joshie Sason and Justin Keener.

Dilorio references multiple other frauds he alerted the SEC to, including Net Element (NETE), which he describes as a money laundering operation linked to WireCard, and for which the SEC brought a related action against SeeThruEquity.

The correspondence serves as an appeal of a preliminary denial of Dilorio's whistleblower award, accusing the SEC Office of the Whistleblower (Janey, Hoecker, Norberg) of obstruction, failing to produce records, and intentionally running out the clock to protect criminals.
